ResourceHeader.Description:
The OBSPM (OBservatoire Solaire de Paris a 
Meudon) heliograph provides 3 images every 1.5 minute of the 
solar disk in the H alpha line at 3 wavelengths: line core and 
at 0.5 Angstroms from it on each side. A Lyot filter with a 
0.5 Angstrom bandpass is used.  The objective is to detect and 
observe solar eruptions at a high temporal cadence.
